Stop making your frustrating edit and point out the POV factor of this article

"award-winning" removed. He is first of all an actor, whther award-winning or not. The awards are mentioned later on

added Rang De Basanti in lead

Khan received SIX previous Filmfare Best Actor nominations before his win in 1996 for ''[[Raja Hindustani]]''.
/* Actor */ Rm unofficial & incorrect nominations for [[Filmfare Best Actor Award]] that don't appear on the original site of the [[Filmfare Awards]].
Rm image from infobox, which doesn't follow Wikipedia guidelines and is going to be deleted soon!!
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 266709177 by [[Special:Contributions/Jaxer|Jaxer]] ([[User talk:Jaxer|talk]]) That kind of information doesn't belong here!!
Aamir Khan was not nominated for an Oscar for Lagaan. The Academy Award for Best Foreign Picture is accepted by the director of a film, not its producer.
elaborated on Lagaan and updated lead sentence
/* Actor */ Khan can be seen making a special app. in [[Zoya Akthar]]'s ''[[Luck by Chance]]'' in the film's latest promo.
Added source in lead to support claim; ''[[Raja Hindustani]]" is STILL his biggest commercial success so far!!
OMG!! I told you; check IBOS!! http://www.ibosnetwork.com/asp/clsActorDisplay.asp?actor=Aamir+Khan&layout=filmography
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 264293373 by [[Special:Contributions/BOLLYWOOD DREAMZ|BOLLYWOOD DREAMZ]] ([[User talk:BOLLYWOOD DREAMZ|talk]])
When adjusted for inflation, RH is still his biggest commercial success so far; please check IBOS. BOI is currently updating their website; we will have to wait for the latest updates!!
RH's inflated net gross is less than dat of Ghajini's current gross as per both the aforesaid websites, plus Ghajini's 200Cr. worldwide gross is much more than dat of RH.
When adjusted for inflation, "Raja Hindustani" is STILL his biggest commercial success to date; even BOI & IBOS states so!!

there are a lot of people named "Aamir". What makes this one special? Please explain rather than redirecting.

The source was an article only about Abul Kalam Azad, not about Aamir Khan. Just read it. Aamir Khaan is nowhere mentioned in the article.
